metadata: (info { (description "O-Shogi is an enlarged version of Shogi which was played in medieval Japan. It was played on a 13x13 board with thirteen types of pieces.") (rules "13x13 board. 68 pieces, 13 types of pieces. ") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "803") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/war/replacement/checkmate/shogi/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Japan, from around 1210 to 1212.") } ) (graphics { (player Colour P1 (colour White)) (player Colour P2 (colour White)) (piece Families {"Defined" "Study"}) (board Style Shogi) (piece Rotate P2 degrees:180) }) (recon { (concept "NumStartComponents" 68) (concept "NumComponentsType" 13) })
